article.title: Esso Research Experiences with Chemical Abstracts on Microfilm
article.author: Weil, H.Emerson, W.G.Bolles, S.W.Lewenz, G.F.
article.text: Late in 1964, The Chemical Abstracts Service announced that in 1965 it would lease Chemical Abstracts in microfilm form to subscribers to its current printed abstracts. With this move, microfilm entered a new stage - use in technical- information work as a publication medium for frequently employed tools rather than for largely archival documents.
